page.title: 12GOLDINGS
page.content: This mansion, set in its own grounds, with numerous outbuildings, was built in the 1870's after the demolition of an earlier mansion in 1875. It was used as a residence of the Abel-Smith family until 1922, whereupon it was bought by the Dr.Barnardo organisation becoming the William Baker Technical School for Orphaned Boys. It continued as such until the 1960's when it was acquired by Herts.County Council. It now houses the County Highways Department and part of the Education Department. There is a T.V studio where courses are run for teachers & children; an Art Store which loans out paintings to schools & a musical instrument repair workshop. The grounds contain various sports pitches, some for public use.
